title: Freshman women track athlete takes top honors at Hampton University awards ceremony – The Virginian - Pilot
body_text:
Hampton University women’s cross country and track standout Peninah Mutisya earned Pirate Athlete of the Year honors as the school recognized its top athletes and teams at the Night of the Pirates Awards Ceremony on Monday at the Hampton Convocation Center.
Mutisya, a freshman from Kitui, Kenya, broke multiple school and CAA records in both the indoor and outdoor seasons. She helped lead the women’s track and field team to the CAA indoor championship, the Pirates’ first league title as a member of the conference.
As a result, the HU women’s track and field team earned Team of the Year recognition.
Mutisya also picked up MVP honors in women’s indoor and outdoor track and field and women’s cross country.
Another track and field athlete, Priscilla Michel, joined soccer player Madisyn Strange with the highest grade point average among HU’s female athletes. Lacrosse player Quinlan Coryat posted the top GPA for the men.
Some of the other award winners included:
- Defensive back Jordan White (football MVP)
- Guard Noah Farrakhan (men’s basketball MVP)
- Guard Jasha Clinton (women’s basketball MVP)
- Pitcher/outfielder Carmynn Bonner (softball MVP)
